medical_history.chief_complaint: Major depressive episode following wife's affair.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Dr. A's depression began when he learned about his wife's affair. Despite the affair ending, the depressive symptoms persisted. He experienced anhedonia, loss of sexual interest, and persistent feelings of depersonalization. His symptoms included difficulties at work, leading to a leave of absence. He showed little affect and experienced transient improvements in response to various medications but continued to have suicidal ideation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of tuberculosis requiring hospitalization and extensive treatment during medical school, followed by a prolonged depression lasting throughout his medical training.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of depression or suicide, but a paternal aunt was hospitalized for psychiatric illness.
medical_history.social_history: Dr. A was a staff anesthesiologist and expressed strong identification with his work. He had been under considerable work-related stress due to a new supervisor.
